results.title: Morvern Callar
results.creator_credit: Lynne Ramsay, Charles Pattinson, George Faber, Robyn Slovo, Alliance Atlantis and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: After the death of her boyfriend a young aimless English woman living in the West of Scotland, assumes the authorship of his unpublished novel and absconds to Spain on a spiritual journey of self-discovery. Silently grieving and struggling to come to terms with his suicide, Morvern is an ambiguous character whose extreme actions belie her gentle, unassuming air. There is something wonderfully maladroit about Samantha Morton’s performance, expertly conveying Morvern’s despair, as she reconciles the calamitous events that subsequently turn to good fortune. The depressing milieu of the Scottish scenes contrast with Morvern’s liberation in sun drenched Spain as she begins to revel in her freedom.

results.title: Mrs. Doubtfire (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Chris Columbus, Mark Radcliffe, Masha Williams, Robin Williams and Blue Wolf
results.brief_description: How far would an ordinary father go to spend time with his children? Daniel Hillard (Robin Williams) is no ordinary father, so when he learns his ex-wife (Sally Field) needs a housekeeper, he applies for the job. With the perfect wig, a little makeup and a dress for all occasions, he becomes Mrs. Doubtfire, a devoted British housekeeper who is hired on the spot. Outrageous, hilarious and often touching, Robin Williams makes this box-office hit a film to be watched again and again.

results.title: When you're in love
results.brief_description: A light romantic musical comedy featuring Cary Grant in the role of Jimmy Hudson, an artist who finds himself involved in a bizarre plot with an Australian opera star by the name of Louise Fuller (played by American born Grace Moore). Louise Fuller is desperate to perform in America but cannot obtain a visa, and the only other way she can enter America is if she is married. On meeting the handsome artist, Louise cons him into a marriage of convenience offering him the sum of $2,000 for his part in the scheme. And so begins a most unlikely liaison, a mis-matched couple who continually battle it out with each other until finally love steps in. The highlight among the many songs featured in the film is “Minnie the Moocher”, a sultry, sexy song wonderfully performed by Grace Moore, an opera singer in real life. Story based on an idea by Ethel Hill and Cedric Worth with original music by Jerome Kern. Cast also includes Aline MacMachon, Henry Stephenson, Thomas Mitchell, Catharine Doucet.

results.title: White Christmas
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Robert Emmett Dolan and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: White Christmas is a treasury of Irving Berlin classics, among them “Count Your Blessings Instead of Sheep”, “Sisters”, “Blue Skies”, and the beloved holiday song “White Christmas”. Two talented song-and-dance men (Bing Crosby and Danny Kaye) team up after the war. One winter they join forces with a sister act (Rosemary Clooney and Vera-Ellen) and trek to Vermont for a white Christmas. The result is “the stuff dreams are made of”.

results.title: Mother night
results.creator_credit: Keith Gordon, Robert B Weide and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Based on a novel by Kurt Vonnegut “Mother Night” follows the story of an American playwright (Nick Nolte) living in Germany during WWII. He is approached by a US agent to become a spy. By broadcasting coded Nazi propaganda on the radio he is able to pass on allied information. During this time he seems to be a convincing Nazi. With only a few knowing his true beliefs he finds himself helpless in Israel on trial for war crimes. A moody story of assumed identity and a man alone in a strange world. Cast includes Alan Arkin, Kristen Dunst, John Goodman and an appearance of Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

results.title: The Last waltz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Robbie Robertson and Last Waltz Productions
results.brief_description: The Band, the American 1970s rock outfit, were together fifteen years. “The Last waltz” is their farewell concert, staged in 1976 and filmed by Martin Scorsese, that featured a plethora of rock stars including Bob Dylan, Joni Mitchell, Neil Diamond, Van Morrison, Emmylou Harris, Ringo Starr, Neil Young, Eric Clapton, Muddy Waters, The Staples, Dr. John, Ronnie Hawkins, Paul Butterfield, Ron Wood and The Band themselves. As well as filming the occasion, Scorsese also interviewed The Band about their lifestyles, the rigours of touring and their reasons for discontinuing. His footage, which includes some frank and very personal moments, acts as a bittersweet look at an era that was just beginning to fade. Still considered, in terms of quality, one of the best rock concerts ever filmed.

results.title: Kuldesak
results.creator_credit: Mira Lesmana, Nan T. Achnas, Riri Riza, Rizal Mantovani and Day for Night Films
results.brief_description: A collaboration by four budding Indonesian filmmmakers, ‘Kuldesak’ intercuts the stories of four young urbanites, exploring problems and dilemmas in contemporary Jakarta. Aksan is an aspiring filmmaker in need of money to finance his first film; Andre, a lonely teen on his birthday who somewhat identifies with Kurt Cobain; Dina, the box office attendant is preoccupied with her television star idol who often comes to the theatre she works at; and Lina, the office girl is taken hostage by her own boss. The film took three years to complete, commencing pre-production in 1996 during the Suharto rule and was released five months after his resignation. Fresh by Indonesian standards, the film showcases the country’s young talents and potential. It is also an illustration of Western influence both on youth culture in Indonesia and filmmaking itself. The cast, as well as musicians appearing on the soundtrack, reads like the who’s who of current Indonesian pop culture. In Indonesian with English subtitles. Not suitable for young teenagers- contains youth suicide and moderate to high levels of violence.

results.title: King of kings
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Ray, Samuel Bronston and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In a time of violence and fear came a man of peace, hope, love and forgiveness. The man was Jesus and he changed the world. Panoramic scenes of clamorous battles between Roman legions and Judean rebels contrast with the serene faith of Jesus. From his birth in a Bethlehem manger, Christ’s life is brought to the screen with simplicity and eloquence: his forty day ordeal in the desert, selection of the Apostles, the sermon on the Mount, Judas’s betrayal, the Passion and the Resurrection.

results.title: The Stunt man
results.creator_credit: Richard Rush and Melvin Simon Productions
results.brief_description: A mysterious fugitive escapes from the law and ends up becoming a stunt man under a mesmerizing, possibly insane movie director (Peter O’Toole). Explores the ever changing nature of reality and illusion. Cast also includes Steve Railsback, Barbara Hershey.
